page.title: 20HUMSHAUGH HOPES AND FEARS
page.content: THE FEAR OF POSSIBLE ILLNESS AND INCAPACITY IS REFLECTED IN A FREQUENTLY EXPRESSED HOPE FOR A CURE FOR{CANCER}IN THE NOT TOO-FAR-DISTANT FUTRE. IN WHAT IS ESSENTIALLY AN AGRICULTURAL COMMUNITY, THE INCONSISTENCY AND UNPREDICTABILITY OF THE{WEATHER}IS A PROBLEM, PERHAPS HIGH-LIGHTED BY THE VERY WET SUMMER OF 1985 WHICH HAS CAUSED MAJOR PROBLEMS TO CROP{FARMERS: THE SHEEP FARMERS TOO HAVE THEIR PROBLEMS, PARTICULARLY IN THE EARLY PART OF THE YEAR WHICH BRINGS THE "LAMBING STORMS". IN THIS AREA, TOO, ALL FARMERS (AND OTHERS!) HAVE TO COPE WITH THE SUDDEN NOISES OF LOW-FLYING {AIRCRAFT}TAKING PART IN THE FREQUENT MILITARY EXERCISES WHICH ARE HELD. DESPITE ALL THE PROBLEMS MOST PEOPLE IN THIS AREA WOULD RATHER LIVE IN THE COUNTRY THAN IN A TOWN.
